org.drools.planner.examples.ras2012

Class ProblemSolution

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.drools.planner.examples.ras2012.Visualizable
      • org.drools.planner.examples.ras2012.ProblemSolution
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.drools.planner.core.solution.Solution<org.drools.planner.core.score.buildin.hardandsoft.HardAndSoftScore>

    public class ProblemSolution
extends Visualizable
implements org.drools.planner.core.solution.Solution<org.drools.planner.core.score.buildin.hardandsoft.HardAndSoftScore>
    This class represents the problem at hand. It holds all the problem entities and values. There are Trains travelling on Routes in a Territory. Each train has Itinerary associated with it through a ItineraryAssignment. Everything except ItineraryAssignment instances and score is fixed and comes from a data set. ItineraryAssignment instances change as the problem's solution changes, resulting in score changes.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ProblemSolution

        public ProblemSolution(String name,
               Collection<Train> trains,
               Territory territory,
               Collection<MaintenanceWindow> maintenances)
        Initialize a fresh problem. Each train will get a route assigned that is considered best for it. See Territory.getBestRoute(Train).
        Parameters:
        name - Name for the problem.
        trains - Trains to travel on the territory.
        territory - Problem's territory, containing routes for trains.
        maintenances - Maintenance windows existing on the territory.

      • getPlanningHorizon

        public long getPlanningHorizon(TimeUnit unit)
        The time window in which to operate. No events outside the <0, $horizon> range will count towards the score. Zero is the present time.
        Parameters:
        unit - Unit of time that the horizon will be returned in.
        Returns:
        The value of the planning horizon, in the chosen unit of time.
